channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Old carpets and household rubbish, 3rd August
item.description:
This has been there for nearly 2weeks. Rubbish has been dumped in between 11-13 Shrubland Road outside of the bin area

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Baby Pigeons trapped making noise - dying, 3rd August
item.description:
The ceiling hole of the estate has been repaired. But it has been completed with the chicks trapped inside. As the job took long, pigeons nested inside. The parents are lingering there day & night on the top of the scaffolding. York row estate. E2 8JA

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Geffrye Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Item, 3rd August
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath - opposite Cobans Kitchen restaurant / Bexleyheath Police Station: Please could you remove a dumped shopping trolley from the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Charlton Church Ln needs cleaning, 3rd August
item.description:
Street is full of rubbish and dog poo, especially in front of businesses. A dead cat has been left there in the street for three days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light too bright, 3rd August
item.description:
The street light shines directly into our bedroom at the front of the house. Despite having blackout curtains at the window our sleep is disturbed on a nightly basis because it is too bright. Please could a light shield be applied to lessen the amount of light emitted, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyme Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street weeds growing in kerbs in Hayes Lane, 3rd August
item.description:
There are street weeds growing in the kerbs in Hayes Lane. These weeds need to be sprayed with weed killer and the 'die-back' removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Hayes Lane, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing on pavement in Bourne Vale, 3rd August
item.description:
There are weeds growing on the pavement in Bourne Vale, especially on the small stretch of road opposite Mead Way. These weeds need to be sprayed with weedkiller and the 'die-back' removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Vale, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown grass verges in Farleigh Avenue, 3rd August
item.description:
The grass verges in Farleigh Avenue are over-grown and need cutting. I do realise that the recent rain and the sunshine have made the grass grow more quickly but the verges do need cutting. Please would you arrange for them to be mown as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farleigh Avenue, Hayes, London

item.title: Large deep pothole outside #12, 3rd August
item.description:
Opened up over the last few weeks. Water leaking from it and will be linked to botched repairs by Thames Water over the last few years. It keeps reappearing after repairs and rapidly deteriorates due to heavy traffic. Whole house shakes when the buses hit it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakdale Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish front of my house, 3rd August
item.description:
Hello dear Sir/Madame Someone is constantly throwing black bags with garbage and furniture at the end of our street. Foxes rummage through everything there at night and the garbage is scattered around. I have already collected it several times and just this morning I collected it again in a pile, it’s a pity I took a photo after I had already collected it. Worms are crawling there and the garbage is rotting. Why do people do this?! This is a dead-end street and I would like to know who throws out large garbage near my house. I have three small children and we are forced to watch this Could you please help us to remove this and do some camera to fine these people Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Congleton Grove, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs to be pruned, 3rd August
item.description:
Tree outside 26 and 28 Ryecroft Road is overgrown and needs to be cut back It is blocking the sunlight and is now too large for the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ryecroft Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish near 29 horsell road/95 midfield way, 3rd August
item.description:
2 weeks this rubbish bag has been left on grass outside and behind the fenceline of houses 29 Horsell road/95 midfield way and has now been torn open so litter is everywhere. Please can the rubbish bag be collected and scattered litter picked up. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Horsell Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
